decision_conditions: The Oaks are situated within the rear garden of 23 Nicholas Way. Collectively they have a high
amenity value and alongside other mature trees form a gradual transition of tree cover between
Ruislip woods and the properties. They significantly contribute to the arboreal character of the
Copse Wood Estate, an area of Special Local Character and have the potential for a long life.
All three Oaks appear to have natural canopies and crown reductions is likely to lead to a managed
appearance rather than a "natural flowing canopy". Further more the trees appear to be in good
health and pruning them would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into their crowns, which
would likely cause stress and lead to infection, affecting their long-term health; this would affect the
safe useful life expectancy of the trees. Pruning would also result in weakly attached re-growth
forming that would be prone to future failure.
The work is unjustified and will have a negative effect on the amenity of the are
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery - to crown reduce by 2m three x Oak trees at T12, T13 and T14 within TPO 234.
